TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit FormError extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an error in the of a form.

remarks.para: Each FormError object in an InfoPath form is associated with a node in the form's underlying XML document. When data validation fails for a particular node, InfoPath creates a FormError object and places it in the FormErrorCollection associated with the form.
There are three types of data validation errors that can occur in an InfoPath form. They can be determined using the property of the FormError class:

item.description: FormErrorType.SchemaValidation Data validation failed as a result of an XML Schema–defined constraint.
FormErrorType.SystemGenerated Data validation failed as a result of constraints defined in the form definition (.xsf) file or as a result of form code calling the method of the class.
FormErrorType.UserDefined Data validation failed as a result of a custom error defined using the method of the FormErrorsCollection class.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the first error in the FormErrorCollection of the form, and then displays the values of all of the properties of the FormError object.
example.code: Public Sub ErrorBtn_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) FormError er = Me.Errors(0) MessageBox.Show("Short message: " & er.Message) MessageBox.Show("Detailed message: " & er.DetailedMessage) MessageBox.Show("Error code: " & er.ErrorCode) MessageBox.Show("Error name: " & er.Name); MessageBox.Show("Error type: " & er.FormErrorType.ToString()) MessageBox.Show("Error site XML: " & er.Site.OuterXml.ToString()) End Sub

MemberSignature.Value: protected FormError ();

public abstract string DetailedMessage { get; set; }
.property instance string DetailedMessage
Public MustOverride Property DetailedMessage As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ DetailedMessage { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DetailedMessage : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the detailed message displayed for the object.
Docs.value: The text of the detailed message.

remarks.para: The detailed error message is the longer error message that can be associated with a control when data validation fails for the data entered (or missing) from the control. Users must click a pop-up menu to display the detailed message.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the object.
Docs.value: A that specifies the type of error.

remarks.para: There are three types of data validation errors that can occur in an InfoPath form that can be determined using the FormErrorType property of the FormError class:

item.description: FormErrorType.SchemaValidation Data validation failed as a result of an XML Schema–defined constraint.
FormErrorType.SystemGenerated Data validation failed as a result of constraints defined in the form definition (.xsf) file or as a result of form code calling the method of the class.
FormErrorType.UserSpecified Data validation failed as a result of a custom error defined using the method of the FormErrorsCollection class.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the short message displayed for a object.
Docs.value: The text of the short message.

remarks.para: The short error message is displayed as a ScreenTip that is associated with a control when data validation fails for the data entered (or missing) from the control.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string Name { get; }
.property instance string Name
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };
member this.Name : string

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the object.
Docs.value: The name specified when the error was created.

remarks.para: The value of the Name property is used only to identify custom errors (errors of type FormErrorType.UserSpecified) in the collection. It is not used for schema validation–generated or system-generated errors. If the type of error is schema validation generated or system generated, the Name property will return a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

Docs.summary: Gets an that is positioned at the node of a form's underlying XML document that is associated with a object.
Docs.value: An positioned at the node associated with the object.

remarks.para: Using the Site property, you can access all of the properties and methods that the XPathNavigator class provides to work with the underlying XML document of the form.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.
